verses.verse: And the child<WH5288> Samuel<WH8050> ministered<WH8334> unto Jehovah<WH3068> before<WH6440> Eli<WH5941>. And the word<WH1697> of Jehovah<WH3068> was precious<WH3368> in those days<WH3117>; there was no frequent<WH6555> vision<WH2377>.

And it came to pass at that time<WH3117>, when Eli<WH5941> was laid down<WH7901> in his place<WH4725> (now his eyes<WH5869> had begun<WH2490> to wax dim<WH3544>, so that he could<WH3201> not see<WH7200>),
and the lamp<WH5216> of God<WH430> was not yet gone out<WH3518>, and Samuel<WH8050> was laid down to<WH7901> sleep<WH1964>, in the temple of Jehovah<WH3068>, where the ark<WH727> of God was<WH430>;
that Jehovah<WH3068> called<WH7121> Samuel<WH8050>; and he said<WH559>, Here am I.

And he ran<WH7323> unto Eli<WH5941>, and said<WH559>, Here am I<WH2009>; for thou calledst<WH7121> me<WH559>. And he said, I called<WH7121> not<WH7901>; lie down again<WH7725>. And he went<WH3212> and lay down<WH7901>.

And Jehovah<WH3068> called<WH7121> yet again<WH3254>, Samuel<WH8050>. And Samuel<WH8050> arose<WH6965> and went<WH3212> to Eli<WH5941>, and said<WH559>, Here am I<WH7121>; for thou calledst me<WH559>. And he answered, I called<WH7121> not<WH1121>, my son; lie down<WH7901> again<WH7725>.
Now Samuel<WH8050> did not yet<WH2962> know<WH3045> Jehovah<WH3068>, neither was the word<WH1697> of Jehovah<WH3068> yet revealed unto him<WH1540>.

And Jehovah<WH3068> called<WH7121> Samuel<WH8050> again<WH3254> the third time<WH7992>. And he arose<WH6965> and went<WH3212> to Eli<WH5941>, and said<WH559>, Here am I<WH7121>; for thou calledst me<WH5941>. And Eli perceived<WH995> that Jehovah<WH3068> had called<WH7121> the child<WH5288>.

Therefore Eli<WH5941> said<WH559> unto Samuel<WH8050>, Go<WH3212>, lie down<WH7901>: and it shall be<WH7121>, if he call thee<WH559>, that thou shalt say, Speak<WH1696>, Jehovah<WH3068>; for thy servant<WH5650> heareth<WH8085>. So Samuel<WH8050> went<WH3212> and lay down<WH7901> in his place<WH4725>.

And Jehovah<WH3068> came<WH935>, and stood<WH3320>, and called<WH7121> as at other times<WH6471>, Samuel<WH8050>, Samuel<WH8050>. Then Samuel<WH8050> said<WH559>, Speak<WH1696>; for thy servant<WH5650> heareth<WH8085>.

And Jehovah<WH3068> said<WH559> to Samuel<WH8050>, Behold<WH6213>, I will do a thing<WH1697> in Israel<WH3478>, at which both<WH8147> the ears<WH241> of every one that heareth<WH8085> it shall tingle<WH6750>.
In that day<WH3117> I will perform<WH6965> against Eli<WH5941> all that I have spoken<WH1696> concerning<WH413> his house<WH1004>, from the beginning<WH2490> even unto the end<WH3615>.

For I have told<WH5046> him that I will judge<WH8199> his house<WH1004> for<WH5704> ever<WH5769>, for the iniquity<WH5771> which he knew<WH3045>, because his sons<WH1121> did bring a curse<WH7043> upon themselves<WH3543>, and he restrained them not.

And therefore I have sworn<WH7650> unto the house<WH1004> of Eli<WH5941>, that the iniquity<WH5771> of Eli<WH5941>'s house<WH1004> shall not be expiated<WH3722> with sacrifice<WH2077> nor offering<WH4503> for<WH5704> ever<WH5769>.

And Samuel<WH8050> lay<WH7901> until the morning<WH1242>, and opened<WH6605> the doors<WH1817> of the house<WH1004> of Jehovah<WH3068>. And Samuel<WH8050> feared<WH3372> to show<WH5046> Eli<WH5941> the vision<WH4759>.
Then Eli<WH5941> called<WH7121> Samuel<WH8050>, and said<WH559>, Samuel<WH8050>, my son<WH1121>. And he said<WH559>, Here am I.

And he said<WH559>, What is the thing<WH1697> that Jehovah hath spoken<WH1696> unto thee<WH3582>? I pray thee, hide it not from me<WH430>: God do so<WH6213> to thee<WH3254>, and more also, if thou hide<WH3582> anything<WH1697> from me of all the things<WH1697> that he spake unto thee<WH1696>.
And Samuel<WH8050> told<WH5046> him every whit<WH1697>, and hid<WH3582> nothing from him<WH559>. And he said, It is Jehovah<WH3068>: let him do<WH6213> what seemeth<WH5869> him good<WH2896>.
And Samuel<WH8050> grew<WH1431>, and Jehovah<WH3068> was with him<WH1697>, and did let none of his words fall<WH5307> to the ground<WH776>.
And all Israel<WH3478> from Dan<WH1835> even to Beer-sheba<WH884> knew<WH3045> that Samuel<WH8050> was established<WH539> to be a prophet<WH5030> of Jehovah<WH3068>.
And Jehovah<WH3068> appeared<WH7200> again<WH3254> in Shiloh<WH7887>; for Jehovah<WH3068> revealed<WH1540> himself to Samuel<WH8050> in Shiloh<WH7887> by the word<WH1697> of Jehovah<WH3068>.
